Check your spam and junk files if you have not already received the email. Most of all be sure to complete the survey through Skyward Family Access.

If you have questions, please contact your child’s campus.

CyberPatriot by Air Force Association and School of Science and Technology San Antonio is holding its Annual Summer Cyber Stallions Camp in June 8-12, 2020.

CyberPatriot is the premier national youth cyber education program, that was created by the Air Force Association in 2009 to promote STEM education.

Thursday, January 23rd Move Texas representatives visited our junior and senior students and provided important information about voting and voter registration cards.

MOVE TX (Mobilize, Organize, Vote, Empower Texas) is a nonpartisan, nonprofit, grassroots organization building power in underrepresented youth communities through civic education, leadership development, and issue advocacy. Unfortunately most texas high schools are not fulfilling the legal requirement to provide voter registration opportunities. Our students learning the voting process every year and getting to know how they can officially be registered. This time we had more than 15 eligible students and some faculty members who got registered on campus during Move Texas visit.

Big thanks to our Social Studies Teachers and our Department Head Ms. Garcia for organizing and inviting Move Texas members to our school!

More voter registration cards are available at the school front office for all SST families and graduates. More details can be found at movetexas.org
